title: SALSA PICANTE: a machine learning attack on LWE with binary secrets. (arXiv:2303.04178v2 [cs.CR] UPDATED)
abstract: Learning with Errors (LWE) is a hard math problem underpinning many proposed post-quantum cryptographic (PQC) systems. The only PQC Key Exchange Mechanism (KEM) standardized by NIST is based on module~LWE, and current publicly available PQ Homomorphic Encryption (HE) libraries are based on ring LWE. The security of LWE-based PQ cryptosystems is critical, but certain implementation choices could weaken them. One such choice is sparse binary secrets, desirable for PQ HE schemes for efficiency reasons. tldr: SALSA PICANTE 提出了一种增强型的机器学习攻击，能够在更大的维度和汉明权重下恢复LWE中的稀疏二进制秘密，这对于落实LWE基础的PQ加密系统的安全至关重要。
en_tdlr: SALSA PICANTE proposed an enhanced machine learning attack that can recover sparse binary secrets in LWE in larger dimensions and with higher Hamming weights, which is crucial for ensuring the security of LWE-based PQ cryptographic systems.
